intro: Stelleropsis altaica subsp. tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
